definition: to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops

sentences.english: Back pain, neck pain, and headache are among the easiest to fake.
sentences.chinese: 背疼，脖子疼和头疼是最容易假造的症状。

sentences.english: Did the United States fake the moon landings?
sentences.chinese: 美国是否假造了登月事件？

definition: to counterfeit/to falsify/to cheat/to defraud/fraudulent/to behave affectedly
to assume sb's name and take his place (idiom); to impersonate/to pose under a false name
lit. to steal a rafter and replace it with a column/to replace the original with a fake/to perpetrate a fraud (idiom)
to compile/to draw up/to fabricate/to invent/to concoct/to make up/to cook up

to make use of/to use sth as pretext/under false pretenses/under the guise of/masquerading as/lenient/tolerant/loan character (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/character acquiring meanings by phonetic association/also called phonetic loan
to counterfeit/to pass off a fake as genuine
